Hi,

 

Is there a way in JUnit to mark certain parts of code as not recommended:
e.g.

 

public static void addRequiredFieldTypes(

                             ArrayList<FieldType> reqFieldTypes, FieldType[]
fieldTypes) {

                   if (reqFieldTypes == null) {

                             if (fieldTypes == null) {

                                      return;

                             }

 

                             reqFieldTypes = new
ArrayList<FieldType>(fieldTypes.length);

                   }

 

                   for (FieldType fieldType : fieldTypes) {

                             if (!fieldType.allowNull() &&
!reqFieldTypes.contains(fieldType)) {

                                      reqFieldTypes.add(fieldType);

                             }

                   }

          }

 

In this snippet: the ArrayList object is created but never returned, and
reqFieldTypes reference does not "know" about the "NEW" reqFieldTypes.

Please keep in mind, that I am not an expert in Java, so this is a result of
a discussion with a co worker. Any suggestions/corrections welcome.

 

Thanks,

-Kamal.
